result.execSummary:
The defendant John J Oropeza was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John J Oropeza is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John J Oropeza was found guilty of Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Filed by Atty Leonie Dolch

Cases heard: 16CF52 & 16CM79, Defendant John J Oropeza in court, in custody with attorney Leonie Dolch.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court found probable cause, bound defendant over.  Reading waived on Information in 16CF52. Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant pled no contest to count 1 in 16CF52. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence withheld, 2 yr. probation, Conds: 30 days jail start June 10, 2016 at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. $518 costs, submit DNA sample. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. Complete anger management counseling. Cts. 2&3 dismissed. 16CM79 read in and dismissed. 68 jail credit.

Defendant John J Oropeza by video, in custody with attorney Leonie Dolch in courtroom.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requested a signature bond, or lower cash bond, and no contact order to be lifted.  State objected to both requests.  Victim present in courtroom.  Argument given by State and Defense.  Court denied the Motion.
Bail/bond hearing at 04-04-2016 02:30 pm
